io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets

Interface TextTable.Style

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TextTable.Box
    Enclosing class:
    TextTable

    public static interface TextTable.Style

    Specifies the characters used to draw the lines and corners of a table. As of now, the whole table is drawn with the same set of characters (we don't allow to customize per row or per cell).

    Typically you would want to use one of the TextTable.Box values, though you may provide your own styles too.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      @Nullable String horizontal()
      Determines the characters used to draw the horizontal lines of a table.
      @NotNull String[] joints(int row)
      Determines the characters used to draw the joints and corners of a table.
      @Nullable String vertical()
      Determines the characters used to draw the vertical lines of a table.

    • Method Detail

      • horizontal

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @Nullable
@Nullable String horizontal()
        Determines the characters used to draw the horizontal lines of a table.
        Returns:
        horizontal line string. If multiple characters, will be repeated and trimmed as required to reach the desired size. If null, horizontal separators will be skipped entirely.
        See Also:
        TextTable.style, TextTable.presetBox(Style)

      • vertical

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @Nullable
@Nullable String vertical()
        Determines the characters used to draw the vertical lines of a table.
        Returns:
        vertical line string. If multiple characters, the column separators will be using the whole string (make sure to have matching T-joints and cross-joints). If null, vertical separators will be skipped entirely.
        See Also:
        TextTable.style, TextTable.presetBox(Style)

      • joints

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @NotNull
@NotNull String[] joints(int row)
        Determines the characters used to draw the joints and corners of a table. The joints are defined as a virtual 3x3 array, with values as follows: 
         String[][] joints = {
     { TOP_LEFT_CORNER    , TOP_T_JOINT    , TOP_RIGHT_CORNER    },
     { LEFT_T_JOINT       , CROSS_JOINT    , RIGHT_T_JOINT       },
     { BOTTOM_LEFT_CORNER , BOTTOM_T_JOINT , BOTTOM_RIGHT_CORNER },
 }
        Parameters:
        row - which row of the 9-box to return.
        Returns:
        array of 3 strings to be used as left corner, center and right-corner for the specified row. See examples in TextTable.Box.
        See Also:
        TextTable.style, TextTable.presetBox(Style)
